Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root() → dict¶
async main.startup() → None¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session, name: str = None, surname: str = None, email: str = None) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • name (str, optional) – The name of the contact to retrieve.

  • surname (str, optional) – The surname of the contact to retrieve.

  • email (str, optional) – The email of the contact to retrieve.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_bdays(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with birthday in next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

Updates an avatar for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • url (str) – The URL of the avatar.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user.

User

  • current_user (User) – The user to create the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Contact | None

async src.routes.contacts.read_users(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 50, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), name: str | None = None, surname: str | None = None, email: str | None = None)¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • name (str, optional) – The name of the contact to retrieve.

  • surname (str, optional) – The surname of the contact to retrieve.

  • email (str, optional) – The email of the contact to retrieve.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm email verification.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Token used for verification.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Message that email is confirmed.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Login user.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – Data of the user to login.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Return dict with access token and refresh token

Return type:

Dict

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh access token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – Authorization credentials.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Return dict with access token and refresh token

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Sends an email to confirm email verification.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The data of the user to confirm email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks.

  • request (Request) – The request to send the email.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Message.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Sign up a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – User details.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks.

  • request (Request) – Request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Dict with user details and message.

Return type:

Dict

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create a new access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Dict of data.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Expiration time in seconds to access token. Default value is 15 minutes.

Returns:

Access token

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Create an email token to send on email verification.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Data to be sent.

Returns:

A token that can be used to verify email.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create a new refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Dict of data.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Expiration time in seconds to access token. Default value is 7 days.

Returns:

Refresh token

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decode a refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – Refresh token to decode.

Returns:

If refresh token is valid, return email of the user. Otherwise, return None/

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Get current user information by token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – JWT token to get user info.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

User data or None if token is invalid.

Return type:

User

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Get an email address from token.

Parameters:

token (str) – A token that can be used to verify email.

Returns:

An email address if valid, otherwise None.

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password)¶

Get the hashed password

Parameters:

password (str) – Password to hash.

Returns:

Hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6380,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify the password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Password to verify.

  • hashed_password (str) – Hashed password from database.

Returns:

True if the password is correct, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
